snippet: With the outbreak in West Africa appearing more out of control than ever, help is finally arriving to assist the local governments in fighting the epidemic.
abstract: Editorial criticizes World Health Organization and other western agencies for painfully slow response to Ebola outbreak in West Africa; holds that while outbreak must be fought primarily by African governments and health care workers, they desperately need help planning effective response; asserts that as cases continue to mount, western doctors and nurses will also be needed to help provide care.
lead_paragraph: With the outbreak in West Africa appearing more out of control than ever, help is finally arriving to assist the local governments in fighting the epidemic.
